title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9770.6 - Sources of funds available for payment of interest
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9770.6 - Sources of funds available for payment of interest

State Regulations

The corporation, where required pursuant to this Part, may
pay interest on invoices from: (a) moneys which represent the proceeds of the issuance of its obligations, where
the contract payment itself is to be made from such moneys; (b) moneys appropriated to the corporation
and not deriving from the issuance of its obligations, where the contract
payment is to be made from such moneys; or
(c) other moneys held by the corporation for
the purposes of making such interest payments. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9770.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
